intro: Barleria mutabilis, commonly known as the variable barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to red, depending on the stage of bloom. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Barleria mutabilis is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
